TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit AnimationTimeline extends System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline

Docs.summary: Defines a segment of time over which output values are produced. These values are used to animate a target property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An AnimationTimeline is a type of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline> object that generates output values based on its timing progress. All animation types inherit from AnimationTimeline.
**Freezable Features:** Because it inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> class, the AnimationTimeline class provides several special features: AnimationTimeline objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe. For more information about the different features provided by <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock AllocateClock() cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.CreateClock%2A> method and should not be called directly by your code.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a modifiable clone of this , making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
Docs.returns: A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property will be even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property was

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock CreateClock() cil managed

Docs.returns: A new clock, created from this .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method shadows the inherited <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.CreateClock%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method with a type-safe implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual object GetCurrentValue (object defaultOriginValue, object defaultDestinationValue, System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock animationClock);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object GetCurrentValue(object defaultOriginValue, object defaultDestinationValue, class System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock animationClock) cil managed

Docs.param: The origin value provided to the animation if the animation does not have its own start value. If this animation is the first in a composition chain it will be the base value of the property being animated; otherwise it will be the value returned by the previous animation in the chain.
The destination value provided to the animation if the animation does not have its own destination value.

The which can generate the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentTime%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress%2A> value to be used by the animation to generate its output value.
Docs.summary: Gets the current value of the animation.
Docs.returns: The value this animation believes should be the current value for the property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Windows.Duration GetNaturalDurationCore(class System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock clock) cil managed

Docs.param: The clock that was created for this .
Docs.summary: Returns the length of a single iteration of this .
Docs.returns: The animation's natural duration. This method always returns a of 1 second.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method provides the implementation for <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.GetNaturalDuration%2A> and should not be called directly from your code.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty IsAdditiveProperty
.field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty IsCumulativeProperty

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this animation uses the *defaultDestinationValue* parameter of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline.GetCurrentValue%2A> method as its destination value.
Docs.value: **true** if the *defaultDesintationValue* parameter of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline.GetCurrentValue%2A> method is the value of this animation when reaches the end of its simple duration (its clock has a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress%2A> of 1); otherwise, **false**. The default implementation always returns **false**.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref:System.Type> of property that can be animated.
Docs.value: The type of property that can be animated by this animation.
